name: FASTBuild Helper
body:
** ------- Web site in construction ----------**

**FASTBuild Helper is an open-source template solution to facilite the integration of [FASTBuild](http://www.fastbuild.org/docs/home.html) on an existing or a new C++ project**

### **The idea**
Personally a really like FASTBuild, this build tool do a very powerful job without any dependencies et complicated installations. But the problem is: if you want to use it, you must be an experimented programmer specially with compilation things and the final syntax is unreadable for a non-fastbuild-integrator.
When I started to integrate FASTBuild in my last company I was beginer with compilers settings and the challenge was to port approximately 375 C++ projects (like VisualStudio projects), so the challenge was really tough but very interesting.

In order to succeed I imaginated an only one interface achieving the following goals:

1. Must be readable and editable for a non-fastbuild-integrator.
2. Should not expose any compilers things for those who don't understand them.
3. Provide a multi-plateform interface.
4. **Should not create another language,** the interface must uniquely be in FASTBuild's language. 
5. Should provide a format which can be generated easily.

### **How to use it**

First, start by reading about the FASTBuild's language. The interface is readable without it but you may be handicapped and quickly do some mistakes. (see: [FASTBuild language](http://www.fastbuild.org/docs/syntaxguide.html))

You have to know that this helper is not perfectly generic for all needs, this one provides a generic interface but in order to support your owns you will have to customize it according to your personnal requirements. In example: this one works with **VisualStudio 2015 in Windows** and **GCC in Linux**, also it will compile all *.cpp files inside your projects directories. But no worries, it's pretty easy to change those settings.

I advise you to start with a little "hello world" test. The helper provides an easy interface but not enough to stay in few lignes. Also you can rely on these [Examples](https://github.com/YannickTriqueneaux/FastbuildHelper/tree/master/Examples).

The interesting thing is if your are interested by [FASTBuild](http://www.fastbuild.org/docs/home.html) but you don't need this Helper, at a minimum, it should probably provide you a realy good example of how to use FASTBuild.
